授業目的:
The 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development (the 2030 Agenda) was adopted by the UN Sustainable Development Summit held in New York in September 2015. It set 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and 169 targets for the international community to achieve by 2030. All 193 member states made a commitment to achieving the 17 interconnected goals. It is expected that people and institutions at all levels of society will contribute to these goals through sustained action.
This course is concerned with global and local action around the sustainable development goals, focusing particular on SDGs 3 Health and Well-being, 4 Quality Education, 5 Gender Equality, 6 Clean water and sanitation,11 Sustainable cities, and 13 Climate action.
到達目標:
By the end of this course it is expected that students will:
1) Gain an understanding of the SDG framework and how it can be used to address long-standing and intractable sustainable development challenges
2) Through case studies, gain concrete knowledge about best practices to achieve goals;
3) Gain an understating of key SDG concepts such as “leave no one behind”, inter-connectedness, synergies and trade-offs, and indivisibility;
4) Become familiar with effective methodologies that can be used to plan and implement global and local projects on sustainable development;
5) Recognize the applicability of the SDGs to students’ own lives and future careers based on an understating how they can be part of the solution to complex issues.
6) Understand the challenges that COVID-19 has thrown to achieving the SDGs.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景: After a general introduction to the SDGs, we will look at goals 3, 4, 5, 6, 11 and 13 in more detail. After this initial introduction, each week we will take case studies of actions being taken at a global and/or local level to help achieve the goals in these areas. As the SDGs are interconnected, we will often be looking at activities aimed at more than one goal at a time. We will take examples from all over the world and from actors at various level from international, national and municipal governments, non-profit organizations and non-government organizations. The case study approach will allow you to gain insights not only into the problem, but also solutions and particularly best practices.
授業方法: An interactive learning environment will be created where students will come prepared to discuss issue based on internet-based research each week. The instructor will offer a brief lecture each week, but following this there will be group work and discussion.
